# ACTIONBOX.md — Behavioral Contract
# Auto-generated by ActionBox. Do not edit manually unless marking as reviewed.

---
version: "1.0"
skillId: calendar-sync
skillName: Calendar Sync
allowedTools:
  - name: google_calendar_read
    reason: Required to fetch events from Google Calendar API
  - name: task_create
    reason: Required to create local task entries from calendar events
  - name: task_update
    reason: Required to update existing task entries when events change
  - name: slack_send_message
    reason: Required to send meeting reminder notifications to Slack
deniedTools:
  - name: shell_exec
    reason: Calendar sync has no need for shell command execution
  - name: file_delete
    reason: Skill should never delete files, only create/update tasks
  - name: google_calendar_write
    reason: Skill is read-only for calendar — must never modify events
  - name: google_calendar_delete
    reason: Skill must never delete calendar events
  - name: http_request
    reason: All network access should go through dedicated API tools
filesystem:
  readable:
    - "./config/calendar.yaml"
    - "./data/tasks.json"
  writable:
    - "./data/tasks.json"
    - "./data/tasks.json.bak"
  denied:
    - "~/.ssh/**"
    - "~/.aws/**"
    - "**/.env"
    - "**/.env.*"
    - "**/credentials*"
    - "**/secret*"
network:
  allowedHosts:
    - "calendar.google.com"
    - "*.googleapis.com"
    - "slack.com"
    - "*.slack.com"
  deniedHosts:
    - "*.onion"
    - "*.tor"
behavior:
  summary: >-
    Reads events from Google Calendar and synchronizes them into the local task
    management system. Creates new tasks for new events, updates existing tasks
    when events change, and sends Slack notifications for upcoming meetings.
    Operates in a read-only manner with respect to the calendar.
  alwaysDo:
    - Verify calendar event data before creating tasks
    - Back up tasks.json before writing changes
    - Include event source ID when creating tasks for traceability
  principles:
    - Prefer read-only operations when possible
    - Fail gracefully if calendar API is unavailable
  neverDo:
    - Delete or modify Google Calendar events
    - Access files outside ./config and ./data directories
    - Execute shell commands or arbitrary code
    - Access SSH keys, AWS credentials, or environment secrets
    - Send messages to unauthorized Slack channels
    - Make HTTP requests to hosts not in the allowed list
  maxToolCalls: 20
drift:
  skillHash: e3b0c44298fc1c149afbf4c8996fb92427ae41e4649b934ca495991b7852b855
  generatedAt: "2025-01-15T10:00:00.000Z"
  generatorModel: claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929
  reviewed: true
  reviewedBy: security-team
